docs.title: 📌 Project Info
docs.text:
This project is powered by the Bedrock Commands Community as part of its annual Map Making Program.

The 2025 winning map concept, "Cooked!", was selected through a community vote from three finalist concepts. These finalists were carefully chosen by the staff team from six original submissions by some of the community's top creators.

This year's Project Director is @CaliFerr, the author of the Cooked! concept.

docs.title: 🍳 Cooked! Overview
docs.text: A fast-paced, multiplayer cooking minigame focused on teamwork and chaos. Dive in and experience a fun and unique culinary adventure within Minecraft!

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: Players race against the clock to prepare and serve dishes in increasingly hectic kitchens. From chopping ingredients to managing stoves, teamwork and coordination are key to success.

docs.title: Gameplay
docs.text:
• Complete orders by gathering, preparing, and cooking ingredients.
  • Navigate dynamic kitchen layouts with obstacles like conveyor belts, moving platforms, or environmental hazards.
  • Work together to keep up with the growing pressure of complex recipes and time constraints.

docs.title: Features
docs.text: Simple mechanics, escalating challenges, and a focus on fun, cooperative gameplay.

docs.title: Contributing to Documentation
docs.text: This guide will help you set up everything needed to edit our documentation, even if you've never coded before!

docs.title: Install Python
docs.text:
1. Go to Python's download page
  2. Click "Download Python" (get the latest version)
  3. Run the installer
  4. Important: Check "Add Python to PATH" during installation

docs.title: Install Material for MkDocs
docs.text:
1. Open Command Prompt (press Windows key, type "cmd", press Enter)
  2. Copy and paste this command:
pip install mkdocs-material

docs.title: Download the project
docs.text:
1. Go to our GitHub page
  2. Click the green "Code" button
  3. Click "Download ZIP"
  4. Extract the ZIP file somewhere on your computer

docs.title: Download the project
docs.text:
1. Open Command Prompt
  2. Navigate to where you extracted the files:
cd path/to/cook-off/docs

3. Start the preview server:

mkdocs serve

4. Open your web browser and go to: http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.title: Edit the documentation
docs.text:
• All documentation files are in the docs folder
  • Files end with .md
  • Open them with any text editor
  • Every time you save, the website will update automatically!

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text: If you get stuck, reach out on our Discord server!

docs.title: Writing Tips
docs.text:
Documents use Markdown formatting: - # Heading - ## Subheading - - Bullet point - 1. Numbered list - **Bold text** - *Italic text*

A quick Markdown cheat sheet might help!

docs.title: Perfect Pancakes Recipe 🥞
docs.text: Create fluffy, delicious pancakes with this simple recipe.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1½ cups all-purpose flour
  • 3½ teaspoons baking powder
  • ¼ teaspoon salt
  • 1 tablespoon sugar
  • 1¼ cups milk
  • 1 egg
  • 3 tablespoons melted butter

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Mix flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a bowl
  2. Whisk milk, egg, and melted butter in another bowl
  3. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients, whisk until smooth
  4. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat
  5. Pour ¼ cup batter for each pancake
  6. Cook until bubbles form, then flip
  7. Cook other side until golden brown

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Don't overmix the batter
  • Let batter rest for 5 minutes
  • Keep pancakes warm in oven at 200°F

Serve with maple syrup, fresh berries, or your favorite toppings! 🍁

docs.title: For the Dough
docs.text:
• 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp sugar
  • 2¼ tsp active dry yeast
  • 1 cup warm water
  • 2 tbsp olive oil

docs.title: For the Topping
docs.text:
• 1 can crushed tomatoes
  • Fresh mozzarella cheese
  • Fresh basil leaves
  • Extra virgin olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Prepare the Dough

    • Mix flour, salt, and sugar in a large bowl
    • Dissolve yeast in warm water
    • Combine wet and dry ingredients
    • Knead until smooth
    • Let rise for 1 hour

  2. Make the Pizza

    • Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C)
    • Roll out dough
    • Add tomatoes, cheese, and basil
    • Drizzle with olive oil
    • Bake for 15-20 minutes

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
• Use high-quality ingredients
  • Let dough come to room temperature before rolling
  • Preheat pizza stone if available

Enjoy your homemade pizza!
